utils

Class Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.Params
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LightweightParams

    public class Params
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    helper class allows searching parameters in a map hierarchically by name.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getParamsMap

        public java.util.HashMap getParamsMap()
        return the underlying map of this object.
        Returns:
        HashMap

      • getInteger

        public java.lang.Integer getInteger(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        get an Integer object corresponding to the passed <name> argument. It searches the keys it knows for an appearance of <name>, but if it cannot find one, it starts dropping parts of the <name> (separated by "." character) from left to right, until it finds a match. This match must then be "mappable" to an int, else it throws IllegalArgumentException. If no match can be found, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getLong

        public java.lang.Long getLong(java.lang.String name)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        same logic as in getInteger(name) but for longs this time.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Long
        Throws:

      • getDouble

        public java.lang.Double getDouble(java.lang.String name)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        same logic as in getInteger(name) but for doubles this time. Any number object is converted to double.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getBoolean

        public java.lang.Boolean getBoolean(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        same logic as in getInteger(name) but for booleans this time. Integer values are also treated as boolean (0 meaning false).
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Boolean
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String name)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        same logic as in getInteger(name) but for strings this time.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getObject

        public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String name)
        same logic as in getInteger(name), but this time it just returns whatever object best matches the input <name>.
        Parameters:
        name - String
        Returns:
        Object null if no ending part of name that is separated from the rest of name by a period (".") is contained in the map.
